description: Request an Uber or Uber delivery all from within your app.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Generate Access Token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID obtained from Uber API.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The Client Secret obtained from Uber API.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code obtained from Uber API.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URI we will redirect back to after an authorization by the resource owner. The base of the URI must match the redirect_uri used during the registration of your application.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: The User Profile endpoint returns information about the Uber user that has authorized with the application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getUserActivity
blocks.description: The User Activity endpoint returns a limited amount of data about a user’s lifetime activity with Uber. The response will include pickup and dropoff times, the city the trips took place in, the distance of past requests, and information about which products were requested.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: offset
args.info: Offset the list of returned results by this amount. Default is zero.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of items to retrieve. Default is 5, maximum is 50.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getProductDetails
blocks.description: The Products Detail endpoint returns information about a specific Uber product. The response includes the display name and other details about the product.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: productId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a specific product for a given latitude & longitude. For example, uberX in San Francisco will have a different product_id than uberX in Los Angeles.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getCurrentRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows retrieving real-time details for an ongoing trip.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows retrieving the status of an ongoing or completed trip that was created by your app.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getProductsByLocation
blocks.description: The Products endpoint returns information about the Uber products offered at a given location. The response includes the display name and other details about each product, and lists the products in the proper display order. Some products, such as uberEATS, are not returned by this endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Coordinates of location.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getProductsPrices
blocks.description: The Price Estimates endpoint returns an estimated price range for each product offered at a given location. The price estimate is provided as a formatted string with the full price range and the localized currency symbol.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: startCoordinates
args.info: Latitude and longitude component of start location.

args.name: endCoordinates
args.info: Latitude and longitude component of end location.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getProductsTimeEstimates
blocks.description: The Time Estimates endpoint returns ETAs for all products currently available at a given location, with the ETA for each product expressed as integers in seconds.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: startCoordinates
args.info: Latitude and longitude component of start location.

args.name: productId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a specific product for a given latitude & longitude.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getUserAddress
blocks.description: The Places endpoint allows retrieving the home and work addresses from an Uber user's profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: placeName
args.info: The name of the place to retrieve. Only home and work are acceptable.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: updateUserAddress
blocks.description: The Places endpoint allows updating the home and work addresses from an Uber user's profile.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: placeName
args.info: The name of the place to retrieve. Only home and work are acceptable.

args.name: address
args.info: The address of the place that should be tied to the given placeName.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getUserPaymentMethods
blocks.description: The Payment Methods endpoint allows retrieving the list of the user’s available payment methods.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: createReminder
blocks.description: The Reminders endpoint allows developers to set a reminder for a future trip.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of when the reminder will occur.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Phone number of the individual to remind. Must be in the E.164 format.

args.name: eventTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of the event time.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Formatted name of the event, which appears in the reminder notification. Alphanumeric up to 50 characters. Defaults to “Your event” if no name is provided.

args.name: eventLocation
args.info: Location of the event, which appears in the Uber app destination field. This does not need to be the entire address string since we rely on the event lat/long to set the destination pin, i.e., “Coit Tower” is sufficient instead of "Coit Tower, 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133".

args.name: eventCoordinates
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventProductId
args.info: Product ID of the Uber product to request. This overrides the product selected by the latitude / longitude pair. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: tripBrandingLinkText
args.info: Call-to-action text for the deeplink to your app. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: tripBrandingPartnerDeeplink
args.info: Deeplink URL to a page in your app where your users can view relevant information and perform actions that will enhance the post-trip experience. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getReminder
blocks.description: The Reminders endpoint allows you to get the status of an existing ride reminder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderId
args.info: The reminder ID.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: updateReminder
blocks.description: The Reminders endpoint allows you to update an existing reminder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderId
args.info: The reminder ID.

args.name: reminderTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of when the reminder will occur.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Phone number of the individual to remind. Must be in the E.164 format.

args.name: eventTime
args.info: Unix UTC timestamp of the event time.

args.name: eventName
args.info: Formatted name of the event, which appears in the reminder notification. Alphanumeric up to 50 characters. Defaults to “Your event” if no name is provided.

args.name: eventLocation
args.info: Location of the event, which appears in the Uber app destination field. This does not need to be the entire address string since we rely on the event lat/long to set the destination pin, i.e., “Coit Tower” is sufficient instead of "Coit Tower, 1 Telegraph Hill Blvd, San Francisco, CA 94133".

args.name: eventLatitude
args.info: Latitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventLongitude
args.info: Longitude of the event location. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: eventProductId
args.info: Product ID of the Uber product to request. This overrides the product selected by the latitude / longitude pair. Required to set destination pin.

args.name: tripBrandingLinkText
args.info: Call-to-action text for the deeplink to your app. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: tripBrandingPartnerDeeplink
args.info: Deeplink URL to a page in your app where your users can view relevant information and perform actions that will enhance the post-trip experience. Used for trip branding and personalization.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: deleteReminder
blocks.description: The Reminders endpoint allows you to remove any reminder in the pending state from being sent.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token. This endpoint only supports server_token.

args.name: reminderId
args.info: The reminder ID.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: requestRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows a ride to be requested on behalf of an Uber user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: startLatitude
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” latitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: startLongitude
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” longitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: The final or destination latitude. Either this or endPlaceId may be specified. If requesting POOL, this parameter is required.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: The final or destination longitude. Either this or endPlaceId may be specified. If requesting POOL, this parameter is required.

args.name: startNickname
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” nickname label.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: startAddress
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” address.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: The final or destination address.

args.name: productId
args.info: The unique ID of the product being requested. If none is provided, it will default to the cheapest product for the given location.

args.name: surgeConfirmationId
args.info: The unique identifier of the surge session for a user. Required when returned from a 409 Conflict response on previous POST attempt.

args.name: paymentMethodId
args.info: The unique identifier of the payment method selected by a user. If set, the trip will be requested using this payment method. If not set, the trip will be requested using the user’s last used payment method.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: fareId
args.info: The key for the upfront price of an uberPOOL ride. Required if we want to use a previously retrieved price estimate for POOL. If it is missed, we will automatically issue a new upfront price for the ride request.

args.name: expenseCode
args.info: An alphanumeric identifier for expense reporting policies. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: expenseMemo
args.info: A free text field to describe the purpose of the trip for expense reporting. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: requestRideById
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows a ride to be requested on behalf of an Uber user using placeIds.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: startPlace_id
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or startLatitude and startLongitude must be specified.

args.name: endPlace_id
args.info: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude may be specified.

args.name: startNickname
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” nickname label.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: startAddress
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” address.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: The final or destination address.

args.name: productId
args.info: The unique ID of the product being requested. If none is provided, it will default to the cheapest product for the given location.

args.name: surgeConfirmationId
args.info: The unique identifier of the surge session for a user. Required when returned from a 409 Conflict response on previous POST attempt.

args.name: paymentMethodId
args.info: The unique identifier of the payment method selected by a user. If set, the trip will be requested using this payment method. If not set, the trip will be requested using the user’s last used payment method.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: fareId
args.info: The key for the upfront price of an uberPOOL ride. Required if we want to use a previously retrieved price estimate for POOL. If it is missed, we will automatically issue a new upfront price for the ride request.

args.name: expenseCode
args.info: An alphanumeric identifier for expense reporting policies. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: expenseMemo
args.info: A free text field to describe the purpose of the trip for expense reporting. This value will appear in the trip receipt and any configured expense-reporting integrations like Uber For Business or Business Profiles.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: updateCurrentRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows updating an ongoing request’s destination.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: endLatitude
args.info: The final or destination latitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endLongitude
args.info: The final or destination longitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: The final or destination address.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: updateCurrentRideById
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows updating an ongoing request’s destination using placeId.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: The final or destination address.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: endPlaceId
args.info: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is accepted. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude must be specified.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: cancelCurrentRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows cancellation of the user's current trip.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getRideEstimate
blocks.description: The Request Estimate endpoint allows a ride to be estimated given the desired product, start, and end locations.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: productId
args.info: The unique ID of the product being requested. If none is provided, it will default to the cheapest product for the given location.

args.name: startCoordinates
args.info: The beginning or "pickup" latitude and longitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: startPlaceId
args.info: The beginning or “pickup” place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or startLatitude and startLongitude must be specified.

args.name: endCoordinates
args.info: The final latitude and longitude. Either this or startPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endPlaceId
args.info: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is acceptable. Either this or endLatitude and endLongitude may be specified.

args.name: seatCount
args.info: The number of seats required for uberPOOL. Default and maximum value is 2.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: updateRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows updating an ongoing request’s destination using the Ride Request endpoint.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: endCoordinates
args.info: The final or destination latitude and longitude. Either this or endPlaceId must be specified.

args.name: endAddress
args.info: The final or destination address.

args.name: endNickname
args.info: The final or destination nickname label.

args.name: endPlaceId
args.info: The final or destination place ID. This is the name of an Uber saved place. Only “home” or “work” is accepted. Either this or endLatitude and end_Longitude must be specified.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: cancelRide
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows cancellation of an ongoing Request on behalf of a rider.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getRideMap
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint getting a map with a visual representation of a Request.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False

blocks.name: getReceipt
blocks.description: The Ride Request endpoint allows getting the receipt information of the completed request.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: The valid access token.

args.name: requestId
args.info: Unique identifier representing a Request.

args.name: sandbox
args.info: UberAPI Sandbox: True || False
